summary: Male only.  Craftable and upgradable mage armor styled after the well known Cleric armor for females.
descriptionHtml:
[u][b]Description[/b][/u]

Adds a new male only armor, styled after the amazing cleric armor for females.

[b]To install multiple unique variants, install the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14194]Male Cleric Armor - Variants[/url] mod.[/b]

This is a non-replacer, and adds a new armor called Cleric armor to the game.  You can select what armor type to use (heavy, light, cloth) and that choice determines both the weight and stats of the armor in-game.  Light and cloth choices can be crafted under the leather crafting perk, while heavy armor is crafted under the ebony category.  In all cases we have taken care to ensure the stats are reasonable and balanced.  Heavy armor closely follows the base ebony stats, while light armor is very close to dragon plate stats.  The crafting recipes are variations of the basic Ebony armor recipes adjusted for the type of armor in question; but there are some important differences that will make acquiring the required ingredients a slight challenge.

Version 2 adds many new features and fixes, including:
[list]
[*]9 Torso armor variants
[*]4 Hand armor variants
[*]7 Rune color options
[*]Helmet and hood options
[*]Bundled body tattoo options by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1018538]Chidosity[/url]
[*]Optional chainmail and leather skin replacement options
[*]Choice of cloth, light, or heavy armor
[*]Support for visible amulets on bare chested torso armor variants
[*]Improved weight slider support for most torso armor variants
[*]All textures re-exported with higher quality to remove compression artifacts
[/list]

[center]
[youtube]htUGrT2ZsE4[/youtube] [youtube]OJwXeLE8TGI[/youtube]
[youtube]BZoQqPoWyIQ[/youtube]
[/center]


[u][b]Crafting[/b][/u]

The crafting recipes can be located under either leather or ebony depending on the choice of armor rating.  If you select light or cloth for armor rating during installation, the crafting recipes will be located under the leather category.  If you select the heavy armor rating, the crafting recipes will be located under the ebony category.


[u][b]Installation[/b][/u]

Nexus Mod Manager is strongly recommended for installation.
If you choose to install the plugin manually, you will need to make several choices about how and what to install.
[list]
[*]Download and unzip the mod archive.
[*]Copy the meshes and texture directories from Required to your skyrim data folder.
[*]Copy the meshes directory from [b]one[/b] of the GauntletVariant directories to your skyrim data folder.
[*]Copy the meshes directory from [b]one[/b] of either the ArmorVariant/DefaultTex or ArmorVariant/ReplaceTex directories to your skyrim data folder.
[*]The nine variants have individual pics inside the FOMOD directory. The names are identical to the directory names that contain the .nifs inside either ReplaceTex or DefaultTex.
[*]If you want chainmail or leather instead of skin, use the meshes from ReplaceTex, and not from DefaultTex.
[*]If you select a torso variant from one of the ArmorVariant/ReplaceTex directories, you will need to copy [b]one[/b] of the SkinVariants to your skyrim data folder.
[*]Default uses whatever skin texture you have installed right now for males.
[*]Tattoo options will replace the base skin texture for all males in the game, and thus if you use DefaultTex armors, you will now have body tattoos.
[*]Chainmail and Leather need a ReplaceTex armor variant, it literally replaces all skin textures with these alternates textures.
[*]Copy the texture directory from [b]one[/b] of the RuneColors directories to your skyrim data folder.
[*]Copy [b]one[/b] of the plugin options from the PluginType directory to your skyrim data folder.  The choice of plugin depends on your armor variant.  Classic, VeryLight, and Robed variants should use a ShowAmulet plugin.  All others should use a HideAmulet plugin.
[*]Activate the MaleClericArmor plugin in the DataFiles window of the Skyrim launcher.
[/list]

[u][b]Update history[/b][/u]

Version 2.3
[list]
[*]Adds a custom hood mesh for Khajit and Argonian characters to fix clipping issues
[/list]
Version 2.2
[list]
[*]Adds a fourth hand armor variant
[/list]
Version 2.1
[list]
[*]Fixes incorrect texture references for the HeavyChain variant
[*]Fixes incorrect normals on HeavyChain variant
[/list]
Version 2.0:
[list]
[*]9 Torso armor variants
[*]3 Hand armor variants
[*]7 Rune color options
[*]Helmet and hood options
[*]Bundled body tattoo options by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1018538]Chidosity[/url]
[*]Optional chainmail and leather skin replacement options
[*]Choice of cloth, light, or heavy armor
[*]Support for visible amulets on bare chested torso armor variants
[*]Improved weight slider support for most torso armor variants
[*]All textures re-exported with higher quality to remove compression artifacts
[/list]
Version 1.5:
[list]
[*]Improved rigging around upper arm armor
[*]Rune colors included with main plugin
[/list]
Version 1.1:
[list]
[*]Limited support for character weights, this should fix any \'detached head\' issues
[/list]
Version 1.0:
[list]
[*]Initial release
[/list]

[u][b]Known issues[/b][/u]

Specific v2 armor variants do not properly support the weight slider.  These are the heavy-full torso, heavy chainmail, and heavy plate variants.
May have compatibility issues with Skyrim 1.5 beta.
[s]Bad weighting on upper arm, found by Syndharos and dhitman.[/s] (Addressed with version 1.5)
[s]There is currently no support for the weight slider.[/s] (Addressed with version 1.1)


[u][b]Credits[/b][/u]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=3566736]Syndharos[/url] - Concepts, art direction, screenshots and installer images
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1980917]NULL9[/url] - Modeling and texturing
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1018538]Chidosity[/url] - Tattoo textures


[u][b]Recommended mods[/b][/u]

The body tattoos featured in some of the screenshots are from
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4180]Tattoos by Barricata[/url]


[u][b]Known compatibility issues[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Custom tattoo skin textures will not work with the Unique Character mod
[*]Custom tattoo skin textures will conflict with other male body texture mods
[/list]

[u][b]Special thanks[/b][/u]

To everyone who put their time and effort into creating all the various modding tutorials which made creating this mod possible; in particular:
The [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=3790]Blender NIF Import-Export Tutorial[/url]
The excellent [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Creating_an_armour_for_Skyrim._Part_1]Creating an armour for Skyrim tutorials on the nexus wiki[/url]
And to all our friends here on the Nexus who supported and encouraged us while working on the 2.0 update
author: NULL9 and Syndharos
